titlestmt.titleproper: Minutes of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science 1892-1970
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Minutes of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865. The Institute's educational programming is offered onsite and at locations around Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This volume contains the meeting minutes of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, from 1892 to 1970. The minutes follow formal rules of order, listing the date, time, attendance, motions, resolutions, and adjournment of the meetings. The minutes indicate the program of lectures planned for each upcoming year. Also included are printed programs for some years for the closing exercises of the lecture season.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: Roll books and general attendance records of the Faculty (90-030) and Records of the Faculty (91-045) contain additional faculty records.
